title: (突發) 美國國務卿重申聲援「香港示威者」

replies.msg:
美國政府同政界有好多好人, 但唔好俾侵侵亂黎

http://www.thestandard.com.hk/breaking-news.php?id=132368&sid=2

Mike Pompeo says HK demos show voice of the governed will be heard
Local | 2 Aug 2019 12:23 pm

U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo speaking in Thailand today urged countries in the region to shun China until it reforms its practices and cited ongoing pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong as an example of how authoritarian rule can threaten economies.

“The current unrest in Hong Kong clearly shows that the will and the voice of the governed will always be heard,” he said.

Pompeo demurred when asked if the U.S. would intervene in the event that China sends in troops to quell pro-democracy protests.

“I’m not tipping our hand to what we will or won’t do,” he said, adding that U.S. officials have “asked China simply to do the right thing.”

Pompeo said the U.S. has a long tradition of supporting people’s rights to free speech and peaceful protest and that those freedoms enhanced prosperity and development.-AP

美國政府同政界有好多好人, 但唔好俾侵侵亂黎

http://www.thestandard.com.hk/breaking-news.php?id=132368&sid=2

Mike Pompeo says HK demos show voice of the governed will be heard
Local | 2 Aug 2019 12:23 pm

U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo speaking in Thailand today urged countries in the region to shun China until it reforms its practices and cited ongoing pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong as an example of how authoritarian rule can threaten economies.

“The current unrest in Hong Kong clearly shows that the will and the voice of the governed will always be heard,” he said.

Pompeo demurred when asked if the U.S. would intervene in the event that China sends in troops to quell pro-democracy protests.

“I’m not tipping our hand to what we will or won’t do,” he said, adding that U.S. officials have “asked China simply to do the right thing.”

Pompeo said the U.S. has a long tradition of supporting people’s rights to free speech and peaceful protest and that those freedoms enhanced prosperity and development.-AP
